list-item.p: 1.2 to 1 mm/day: This sequence is mapped in the vegetation domination region (III) with soil patches remaining primarily spotty. Throughout the continuous rainfall decrease experiment, the soil pattern remained highly fragmented, with an almost constant eccentricity ratio (~1).

1 to 0.8 mm/day: The labyrinth-like vegetation-soil patterns evolved in the discrete rainfall experiment at 1 mm/day rainfall and were maintained throughout this rainfall interval. ERs are within Region II and remain almost constant (~1.2).
0.8 to 0.6 mm/day: Vegetation patterns are highly spotty. ERs decrease following the ER:R line as defined for the discrete experiment results.
